metadata.case_name: Commissioner of Wealth Tax, Madras v. Respondent

facts.text: Respondent is a public limited company incorporated under the Indian Companies Act, 1913 in 1939, carrying on business of manufacture of absorbent cotton wool.
In March 1955, Board of Directors resolved to establish new spinning unit named Sudarsanan Spinning Mills.
Licence obtained from Government of India under Industries (Development and Regulation) Act, 1951 in August 1955.
Orders placed for purchase of necessary spinning machinery and plant in January and February 1956.
Construction of factory buildings taken in hand in March 1956, completed by December 1957.
Erection of spinning machinery and plant completed in several stages commencing from June 1957.
Licence from Inspector of Factories for working the factory obtained in June 1958.
Time given to complete the project extended by Government up to 17th March 1959.
Wealth Tax Act came into force on 1st April 1957.
For assessment year 1957-58, valuation date 30th September 1956, respondent claimed deduction of Rs. 1,43,727 as amount laid out in setting up new unit.
Wealth Tax Officer disallowed claim on ground that unit set up prior to 1st April 1957.
Appellate Assistant Commissioner and Income-tax Appellate Tribunal upheld disallowance.
At request of respondent, question referred to Madras High Court: Whether Rs. 1,43,727 exempt under section 5(1)(xxi) read with second proviso of Wealth-tax Act.
Madras High Court answered question in favour of respondent on 14th March 1962.
Appeal by special leave to Supreme Court by Commissioner of Wealth Tax, Madras.

legal_issues.text: Whether the asset of Rs. 1,43,727 is exempt under section 5(1)(xxi) read with the second proviso thereunder of the Wealth-tax Act?

petitioner_arguments.text: Main provision of clause (xxi) should be interpreted in conjunction with second proviso; new and separate unit set up only when company commences operations for establishment of such unit.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Section 5(1)(xxi) and second proviso; Maxwell on Interpretation of Statutes

petitioner_arguments.text: Operations for establishment commenced before 1st April 1957, so unit set up prior; exemption not available for 1957-58 as operations commenced simultaneously with setting up after Act.

respondent_arguments.text: Unit set up only when factory erected, plants and machinery installed, and ready to commence business, which was after 1st April 1957.

court_reasoning.text: A unit is set up when it is ready to discharge function, i.e., ready to commence business; operations for establishment precede setting up.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Word 'set up' in principal clause equivalent to 'established', different from 'operations for establishment' in proviso.

court_reasoning.text: On facts, unit completed after 1st April 1957 (buildings Dec 1957, machinery from June 1957, licence June 1958); principal clause satisfied.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Operations commenced before 1st April 1957, so first assessment year 1957-58 qualifies under proviso.

court_reasoning.text: Commissioner's new contention that operations commenced after 1957-58 not raised before Tribunal; cannot be raised now.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Question must be answered on basis accepted by Tribunal.

holdings.text: Exemption under section 5(1)(xxi) read with second proviso applicable; Rs. 1,43,727 deductible for assessment year 1957-58.

precedents_cited.case_name: Western India Vegetable Products Ltd. v. Commissioner of Income-tax, Bombay City
precedents_cited.relevance: Expression 'set up' means ready to commence business, distinct from commencing operations.

precedents_cited.case_name: Commissioner of Income-tax, Bombay v. Scindia Steam Navigation Co. Ltd.
precedents_cited.relevance: New questions not raised before Tribunal cannot be raised in higher courts.

statutes_cited.name: Wealth-tax Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Exemption for assets employed in new unit set up after commencement of Act; period from assessment year following commencement of operations for establishment.

outcome.summary: Appeal dismissed; High Court decision upheld; respondent entitled to exemption of Rs. 1,43,727 under section 5(1)(xxi) for assessment year 1957-58.

key_quotes.text: "A unit cannot be said to have been set up unless it is ready to discharge the function for which it is being set up."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "Operations for establishment of a unit... must precede the actual setting up of the unit."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "The expression 'set up' means... to place on foot or to establish, and is in contradistinction to 'commence'."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Adopts Bombay HC view on 'set up'.
